Job.Name: Fitness App FRD + Build
Job.Description:
Creation of detailed Feature and Function Specifications. Development, Deployment and Testing of an MVP of the Fitness App.
Hours are estimated by Task and totaled for the Project Actual hours will be tracked, and reported on a regular cadence Actual hours will be billed on a regular cadence (typically every 2 weeks) Hours per Task and Project may be adjusted with approval/ notice NOTE: Some work may be completed by talent on set contracts (not hourly) Duration may be extended or shortened and total hours adjusted with approval/notice

Task.Name: 20501 Concept / Design Creation
Task.Description: Define detailed Feature and Function specifications and requirements

Task.Name: 20501 Development + Testing
Task.Description:
Build/Code and test an MVP of the Fitness App Utilizing the MVP Product Requirements Document as a guide, the following deliverables will be included in Development and Deployment: 1. RTC – Real-time Communication a. Integration with RTC provider to provide connections between multiple parties b. Support for 1 to 1 and 1 to many sessions c. Support for mobile devices i. Student will be able to join a session from their phone or tablet d. Provider: Twilio Video or similar e. Session limitations (duration, qty) 2. Music Provider Integration a. Requires additional research for source integration. b. Allow Trainer to toggle music stream 3. Web App a. Public Trainer Profiles i. Unique Marketable URL ii. Sharable Actions iii. Visitor tracking iv. Displays Classes v. Displays Calendar View vi. User can Select Class to see Class Details b. Trainer Dashboard i. Ability to create classes ii. See stats iii. See upcoming classes iv. Start a class v. Ability to integrate limited email marketing/sending (to be defined) vi. Ability to push class details/marketing posts to Social (to be defined) vii. Ability to select a charity partner from an integrated dropdown (based on Pledge.io plugin) c. Booking workflow with Class Type Logic i. Class selection ii. Support for one-time class purchase (single purchase) iii. Support for unlimited classes by trainer (subscription) d. Schedule/Calendar/Availability management i. Ties in with Class creation, ability to see available times, set class times, durations, and calendar ii. Support for cancelation e. Support for rescheduling f. Student Account and dashboard i. Account management • Manage payment information • See order history ii. Upcoming classes iii. Ability to join an upcoming class iv. Subscription management • Ability to cancel/modify their subscriptions g. Admin Dashboard i. Ability to see statistics ii. Ability to see active users iii. Ability to see active classes iv. Ability to join classes in a hidden mode (moderator style) v. Ability to manage teachers • Onboard, cancel, message vi. Ability to manage system email templates 4. Payment Integration i. Checkout functionality for a user to purchase 5. Notification System i. Email (integration with SendGrid type of tool) ii. SMS (integration with Twilio type of tool) iii. Transactional messaging for all user actions and class status iv. Tokenized emails for joining a scheduled class v. Reminders vi. Ability to manage system settings 6. Testing and Deployment a. Internal Testing and QA b. UAT phase, testing with client 7. Code & Documentation a. Code Delivery to client’s repo i. If Customer does not have a code repository, Assemble will assist in creating such on the Customer's behalf b. Deliver documentation to Customer upon project completion i. Includes technical spec documentation outlines technical details such as programming language, frameworks, libraries used, etc
Includes user guide that outlines how the application works. This is structured via screenshots and explanations of the various features and functions
